definition: to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support

sentences.english: Without strong government backing, the private sector was loth to fork out.
sentences.chinese: 沒了政府撐腰，私人企業掏起錢來心不甘情不願。

sentences.english: Iraq shares a table, before is always bullied by Iraq, has class leader to support luckily.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克同桌，以前老被伊拉克欺負，幸好有班長撐腰。

sentences.english: Now that they were backed up, these fellows became audacious in the extreme.
sentences.chinese: 一旦有人撐腰，這幫傢伙就變得膽大包天。

sentences.english: Many of these markets are operating only because the government is propping them up.
sentences.chinese: 僅僅只是因爲政府在撐腰，許多這樣的市場還在維持。

sentences.english: The military-backed government has heavily censored the news.
sentences.chinese: 有軍方撐腰的政府對新聞進行了嚴格審查。

sentences.english: The lady is forever so good to elder sister of vegetable Yun, will definitely give assist as her.
sentences.chinese: 夫人一直對素芸姐姐這麼好，一定會爲她撐腰的。

definition: lit. to see only the other rider's dust and have no hope of catching up (idiom)/to be far inferior
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
